intro: Sarcozygium kaschgaricum, commonly known as the Kashmir rose, is a shrub native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has elliptical leaves with a slightly serrated margin and produces small, red berries that are edible. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. The botanical features of Sarcozygium kaschgaricum make it a notable species in the Rosaceae family.
